intro: Hedyotis goreensis, commonly known as the African bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows as a small herb with opposite, oval-shaped leaves and produces small white or yellow flowers. It is often found in moist habitats such as forests and wetlands. The plant has been used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
